events.name: GDG Perth Meetup Oct 2019: Smart City and Urban Planning Life.
events.description:
In our GDG Meetup on the 7th October 2019, we are privileged to have two amazing speakers who will share with us all things related to Smart City and Urban Planning Life.

Event Agenda
18:00-18:15: Opening and Networking

18:15-19:15: Session 1: Connected Urbanism and Cohabitation in the Smart City
Speaker: Prof Marcus Foth, QUT Design Lab.

19:15-19:45: Session 2: Building Industry in the Information Age
Speaker: Tom Young, CEO of UDrew.

19:45-20:15 Q&A

20:15-20:30: Networking

Note:
In addition to the agenda above, we will also have another meeting prior to the meetup for members of Western Australia ACM SIGCHI Chapter (WACHI) members or enthusiasts from 17:00 - 18:00 WIB. All members are invited to come.

---
Speaker Biography
Prof Marcus Foth
Marcus Foth is Professor of Urban Informatics in the QUT Design Lab, Creative Industries Faculty at Queensland University of Technology. He is also an Honorary Professor in the School of Communication and Culture at Aarhus University, Denmark, and a Visiting Professor in the Department of Design, Politecnico di Milano, Italy.

Professor Foth‚Äôs research brings together people, place, and technology. His transdisciplinary work is at the international forefront of human-computer interaction research and development with a focus on smart cities, community engagement, media architecture, internet studies, ubiquitous computing, and sustainability.

He founded the Urban Informatics Research Lab in 2006 and the QUT Design Lab in 2016. Ahead of their time and before the term ‚Äúsmart cities‚Äù became popular, Foth pioneered a new field of study and practice: Urban informatics examines people creating, applying and using information and communication technology and data in cities and urban environments.

Professor Foth has received over $6 million in national competitive grants and industry funding. He received a Queensland Young Tall Poppy Science Award 2013, and was inducted by the planning, design and development site Planetizen to the world‚Äôs top 25 leading thinkers and innovators in the field of urban planning and technology.

Tom Young
After spending a lifetime within the building industry, specialising as a Geotechnical Analyst, Structural Draftsman and Systems Engineer and with a background in science and engineering, Tom Young taught himself coding and technology. He then built the original uDrew beta system following almost a decade of research and development. The past year, Tom was recognised by the Western Australian State Government as WA's Overall Innovator of the Year for his work with uDrew, was the recipient of WA's 40 under 40 award for his contribution to the WA community and is presently expanding uDrew operations internationally. Tom is driven by passion, curiosity and the desire to learn, and is usually up for a beer and a yarn when time permits.

---
Hosted by
Google Developer Group Perth
~ A platform for developers, designers, business, marketing, technology enthusiasts to explore cutting edge of technologies, including Google Technologies, and how they can make an impact in our life ~

Sponsored and supported by
1. Customer Experience Insight Pty Ltd | cxinsight.com.au
3. PT UXINDO Digital Indonesia (UX Indonesia) | uxindo.com

Collaborators:
WACHI
UX Machines

Venue Sponsor
WeWork Perth
32/152 St Georges Terrace, Perth
https://www.wework.com/l/perth--WA

events.name: Introduction to Google Design Sprint
events.description:
This introductory workshop provides an overview of Google Design Sprint, a proven methodology for solving problems through designing, prototyping, and testing ideas with users. Within 5 days, you and your team are expected to be able to shift from ideas to prototype and ultimately well-grounded decision based on your target user feedback. These five days will save you and your teams countless weeks, months, and in some cases millions of dollars of investing in a wrong decision.

Initially developed at Google by Jake Knapp, John Zeratsky and Braden Kowitz when they were at Google Venture, this methodology started with a vision to grow UX culture and the practice of design leadership across the organization. Design Thinking is one of the key foundations in the development of this methodology.

Multiple teams within Google experimented with different methods from traditional UX practice, IDEO, the Stanford dSchool, business strategy, and even psychology, applying them to support divergent and convergent thinking with teams.

This method has been successfully applied not only across Google but also in hundreds of startups, corporations and organizations around the world.

== 00 ==

About the workshop:
This introductory workshop is held as a part of pre Google DevFest 2019 events that will be held on the 29th Nov 2019 (http://bit.ly/gdevfest-perth2019).

Place: WeWork - 32nd Floor 152 St George Tce, Perth
Date: Wednesday, 23rd October 2019
Time: 10am - 12pm
Number of Participants: 10
Participant Profile: Technology, Design and Business Professionals
Level: No prior knowledge is required, just your enthusiasm, curiosity, and smiles
Fee: AU $0 (Complimentary)
Registration: Mandatory (First In, Best Dressed)

There will be several dates and times offered (check on the https://meetup.com/gdgperth), but if the number of participants is below 10, the workshop will be cancelled or merged. First In, Best Dressed, Registration is mandatory.

== 00 ==

About Workshop Facilitator:
Josh (Adi Tedjasaputra)
Google Design Sprint Certified Master | First Google Mentor in Product and Design Strategy in Australia | Director of Customer Experience Insight Pty Ltd

As a Google-certified Design Sprint Master, Josh builds and nurtures business and innovation at UX Indonesia and Customer Experience Insight Pty Ltd.

He has a passion for the design, development, and use of Information and Communication Technology for solving business problems and leveraging the User Experience of products and services. For more than 20 years, he has been helping international companies in creating business strategy, disruptive technology, marketing, and branding of successful products and services.

With his engineering and computer science background, combined with his native and deep insights on Indonesian business ecosystem, he has introduced strategic and sustainable solutions that optimize the bottom line of businesses in different vertical industries, while at the same enhancing the life quality of millions of users and customers in Indonesia and around the world.

His expertise includes Intranet and Internet Portal technology, Financial Technology, Usability Engineering, Agile UX, Design Thinking, Computational Thinking, Design Sprint, the Internet of Things, Machine Learning, Big Data, and Artificial Intelligence.
events.how_to_find_us: WeWork, 32nd Floor, 152 St Georges Tce, Perth, WA 6000

events.name: GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Volunteer+Speaker Dinner
events.description:
Google DevFest Perth 2019 season is an annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, workshop and more! This is our very first DevFest in Perth and we are aiming to reach out as many as people like yourself.

This Pre-DevFest Dinner is our way of thanking and appreciating our amazing volunteers and speakers for Google DevFest Perth 2019 who have signed up to make this event a success.

This event is exclusive to Google DevFest Perth 2019 Volunteers and Speakers, sponsored by Customer Experience Insight Pty Ltd.

events.name: GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Campus Connect
events.description:
Google Developer Group (GDG) Perth in collaboration with the Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering, University of Western Australia is organizing:

"GDG Devfest Perth 2019: Campus Connect"

This is the first part of the four GDG Devfest events that aims to reach out developers, designers and business people who currently work in the academic sector. This event, however, is also open for public (RSVP is required)

Event Details:

Place: EZONE Building, The University of Western Australia (Linked to Building 222)
Date: 29th November 2019
Time: 08:30 - 10:30 am
Program: Seminar
RSVP: Required by 22nd Nov 2019

Program
08:30 - 08:40 Opening Remarks (UWA and GDG Perth)
08:40 - 09:00 Matt Turner, Google Cloud Architect, Google, Australia
09:00 - 09:20 Erin Zimmer, Senior Developer, Shine Solutions Group and Google Expert in Web Technologies.
09:20 - 09:40 Sachin Kumar, Google Developer Expert | CTO - TupeloLife
09:40 - 10:00 Kaz Sato, Developer Advocate, Google, Japan.
10:00 - 10:20 Eunice Sari, Co-Founder and Google Mentor in Product Design and Strategy, Customer Experience Insight, Australia
10:20 - 10:30 Closing Remark (UWA and GDG Perth)

Related Information:
There will be 4 (four) different GDG Devfest events during the day:
1. GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Campus Connect (UWA,[masked]:30 am). RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-uwa

2. GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Lunch Talk (Central Park Conference Centre, 11:30 am - 02:00 pm).
RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-lunchtalk

3. GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Workshop (Central Park Conference Centre, 02:00 am - 03:30 pm).
RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-workshops

4. GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Women Techmakers (Scitech, 6-8 pm)
RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-wtm

This event is sponsored by
University of Western Australia
CX Insight Australia (cxinsight.com.au)
Google Australia
events.how_to_find_us: EZONE is located at building 222 along the Western boundary at Fairway. Find out more - www.uwa.edu.au/Facilities/EZONE

events.name: GDG DevFest Perth 2019: Lunch Talk
events.description:
Google DevFest Perth 2019 season is an annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, workshop and more! This is our very first DevFest in Perth and we are aiming to reach out as many as people like yourself.

There will be tech talks by experts from our community, Google Developer Experts and Googlers. You will learn about AI, Android, Google Cloud Platform, Machine Learning, Flutter and many more. Prizes will be given out throughout the event. Don‚Äôt miss this great opportunity to learn from experts and network with the other developers!

There will be 4 (four) different GDG DevFest events during the day:
1. GDG Devfest Perth 2019: Campus Connect (UWA,[masked]:30 am). RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-uwa

2. GDG Devfest Perth 2019: Lunch Talk (Central Park Conference Centre, 11:30 am - 02:00 pm).
RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-lunchtalk

3. GDG Devfest Perth 2019: Workshop (Central Park Conference Centre, 02:00 pm - 03:30 pm).
RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-workshops

4. GDG Devfest Perth 2019: Women Techmakers (Scitech, 6-8 pm)
RSVP: http://bit.ly/devfest2019-wtm

This is the second part of the four GDG DevFest events that aims to give hands-on experience for anyone who are interested to learn about Google Technology - newcomers are welcome (RSVP is required)

Program:
11:30 - 11:45 Lunch Networking
11:45 - 11:50 Opening Remarks
11:50 - 12:05 Kaz Sato, Developer Advocate, Google, Japan.
12:05 - 12:20 Erin Zimmer, Senior Developer, Shine Solutions Group and Google Expert in Web Technologies, Melbourne, Australia
12:20 - 12:35 Adi Tedjasaputra, Co-Founder and Google Mentor in Product Design and Strategy, Customer Experience Insight, Australia

01:20 - 01:35 Anton Ball, Developer, Seven West Media, Australia
01:35 - 01:50 Leah Kaplan, Customer Engineer, Google Cloud, Australia
01:50 - 02:00 Closing Remark

answers.question: Why are you interested to join Google Developer Group Perth?

group_profile.intro: I am Co-Founder of Customer Experience Insight Pty Ltd, CEO and Co-Founder UX Indonesia, Woman Techmakers Ambassador,  Google Mentor in Product Design and Strategy, and Google Developer Group (GDG) Manager Perth

answers.question: Why are you interested to join Google Developer Group Perth?
answers.answer: I am a Google Developer Expert interested in accelerating digital transformation
